warrior.name: Warrior
warrior.about: The basic melee unit, which all tribes have access to from the beginning, and most start with.

rider.name: Rider
rider.about: Often the second unit used in a game, riders are good for exploring (especially when used in pairs), and attacking ranged units. Oumaji starts with a rider.

defender.name: Defender
defender.about: A strong defensive unit, best used in a ship or battleship as it provides high health and defence for low cost. Quetzali starts with a defender.

swordsman.name: Swordsman
swordsman.about: Swordsmen are a much stronger melee unit than the warrior, however they are rarely used since the technology branch is not very useful. Vengir starts with a swordsman.

archer.name: Archer
archer.about: The basic ranged unit, archers are usually the second unit used in a game when it is not the rider. Because they have dash, they are sometimes more useful than the catapult, even if we ignore price. Hoodrick starts with an archer.

catapult.name: Catapult
catapult.about: A more powerful ranged unit than the archer, catapults are strong against naval attacks and giants, however their usefulness is limited by the fact that they do not have dash, and their price.

knight.name: Knight
knight.about: The strongest trainable melee unit in the game, knights act like a combination of riders and swordsmen, with the added ability to kill multiple units in a single turn. They are useful late game, but very expensive.

giant.name: Giant
giant.about: Giants have the best attack, defence and health in the game, making them possibly the best melee unit in the game. They are best used in battleships or for sieging cities. They can be obtained in ruins, or by upgrading a city to level 6 or higher.

boat.name: Boat
boat.about: The basic naval unit, boats are created when a land unit moves onto a port tile. Boats are rarely useful due to their low defence, but they can be spammed cheaply once you have sailing.

ship.name: Ship
ship.about: Ships are upgraded boats, and are much more useful in combat. They are possibly the most used naval unit.

battleship.name: Battleship
battleship.about: Battleships are upgraded ships, and the best naval unit (for human tribes, at least).

mind_bender.name: Mind Bender
mind_bender.about: Mind benders are perhaps the least used unit, since the tech tree that they are on is not very useful, and they are weak since they cannot dash. However, when used in pairs or kept behind the fog, they can effectively prevent sieges.

nature_bunny.name: Nature Bunny
nature_bunny.about: Nature bunnies are an easter egg. They cannot be controlled by any tribe, even using a mind bender. They can only be spawned in single player, by tapping 10 times on an empty field in your territory.

amphibian.name: Amphibian
amphibian.about: Amphibians are amphibious melee units unique to Aquarion. They can be used in a similar way to riders, with the bonus that they can travel on water. They replace the rider.

tridention.name: Tridention
tridention.about: Tridentions are amphibious ranged units unique to Aquarion. They replace knights, but are used more like ships or battleships.

crab.name: Crab
crab.about: Crabs are amphibious melee units unique to Aquarion. They replace giants, and are created the same way.

polytaur.name: Polytaur
polytaur.about: Polytaurs are created by converting animals within your territory for 2 stars. This can only be done as Elyrion. Polytaurs can be effectively spammed using multiple sanctuaries. They are melee units, in between warriors and swordsmen for strength.

navalon.name: Navalon
navalon.about: Navalons, similar to polytaurs, are created as Elyrion by converting whales within your territory for 5 stars. They are very strong naval units, especially early-mid game when your opponent may have 10hp naval units.

dragon_egg.name: Dragon Egg
dragon_egg.about: Dragon eggs are the first form of the Elyrion super unit, and are almost useless as they are unable to attack (unless placed in boats). They are created like giants, and should be kept safe until they hatch, after 3 turns.

baby_dragon.name: Baby Dragon
baby_dragon.about: Dragon eggs are the second form of the Elyrion super unit. They are created after a dragon egg has been alive for 3 turns. They are melee units, but should generally be kept out of fighting until they grow into fire dragons, after 3 turns.

fire_dragon.name: Fire Dragon
fire_dragon.about: Fire dragons are the third and final form of the Elyrion super unit. They are created after a baby egg has existed for 3 turns. They are powerful ranged units, and can also be used for exploring.

mooni.name: Mooni
mooni.about: Moonies are the starting unit of Polaris, and can only be trained by Polaris. They are used for freezing terrain and units. They can be used in pairs for exploring water, or to keep enemy units frozen while other units attack them.

ice_archer.name: Ice Archer
ice_archer.about: A ranged unit that freezes it's targets rather than dealing damage (0.1 attack is not enough to to damage, it just allows them to capture cities). They can be used to prevent enemy advance, or keep unranged attackers on full health by preventing retaliation.

battle_sled.name: Battle Sled
battle_sled.about: Battle sleds are melee units that should almost always be used on ice, as they loose dash, escape and 3 movement on land. They are cheaper than knights, and effective when spammed.

ice_fortress.name: Ice Fortress
ice_fortress.about: A polaris exclusive ranged unit. A powerful late game alternative to catapults, but with high health and defence, making them good at defending cities and much less susceptible to knights.
